The best view of authentic lisbon, and also some scenery. Arrived late (1am or so) oN a friday, and was recomended to go here. Very safe and beautiful at night. Beatiful View!. Strongly recommend you to go during the sunset. Is breathtaking. And also there won't be many people around so you can have a quiet time looking at the view.

How to leave this beautiful place.... We know we never really leave a place, it's locked in memory and, when the view is as beautiful as this, in hearts. The blue sky, the terracotta buildings, the shady benches, the grand old trees, the artisan lemonade, the tasty crepes, guitar music...a place to gaze, a place to read, a place to allow you breath to be taken away. So here is how I suggest you leave. Walk downhill past the noisy tuk-tuks queueing to arrive and then turn right into the larger road following the tram lines. Walk a couple of hundred yards and then turn left downhill when you see the river, again following the tram lines. Narrow streets, down, down you go, past all the crooked old houses, there are cafes and small restaurants serving grilled food, down towards Alfama where there are even more restaurants, bars and wine bars. And you are then by the Rio Tejo. About 45 minutes in total, downhill momentum and curiosity will make it seem like no time at all!

Best view of Lisbon. Lisbon is full of miradouros (belvederes), and even though most say the Miradouro da Graça is the most beautiful one (it is indeed one of the biggest ones, with benches and drink kiosks), it is not :-) just a few hundred meters away is the Miradouro Nossa Senhora do Monte, smaller but with a much better view. Offering a view slightly higher than the Graça (and accessible through some stairways in the Graça district), on a clear day you can see Lisbon from the Castle São Jorge on your left down to the Belem Tower on your right. Some say this was the spot where the Marquis of Pombal inspected the rebuilding of Lisbon after the XVIII century Earthquake. If you want great views from the city and do not want to be interrupted by tens of tourists (that are always around the Miradouro da Graça), this is your spot.

Nice View. A nice view of the São Jorge (St. George) Castle and Lisbon. We walked from the castle to this overlook.

Fantastic scenic viewpoint. We visited the Miradouro de Senhora do Monte as part of a one hour tuk tuk tour around Alfama. The cost was E 45 for the hour on board.The view from do Monte was of course fabulous - a superb vista of Lisbon, as good as any you will find.Is it THE best as many sites suggest? Perhaps, but it is really that much better than the splendid views from the Castle.We certainly enjoyed our visit there.

It used to be a hidden marvel. It is hard to get there if you're not fit, and even if you are you will be panting when you reach the top. But it will be worth every single step you took - the sight is a great payoff, and the breeze is a bonus.Problem is, it is hard to find a place to sit there, since it has become increasingly popular. It is, however, still more quiet and peaceful here than in Miradouro da Graça, partly because there is no cafe/kiosk here (so I recommend you bring your own beverage).Also, there will be a lot of Tuk Tuks there too.
Beautiful at sunset!. Lovely panoramic views from this outlook point in Graca. There is a kiosk/café where one can sit and enjoy drinks and snacks.

One of the best privaate collections. The permanent collection is good, but do check out if there another temporary exhibit. When I visited, they had the private collection of the royal family of Spain. Overall, you can spend about 2 hours watching each exhibit.

Spectacular view!. My husband and I happened upon this view by chance while wandering around the Graca area of Lisbon. Wow! It says a lot about a city when a view this beautiful can be accessed for free, and while just exploring the area. I plan to return with a camera next time!

TOP VIEW. The best point for see Lisbon! Totally recommended, you have a very nice view on Sao Jorge castle, Sao Vicente, the 25th April bridge, Praça do Commercio, the statue of the Christ, and the city of Lisbon

Amazing view and so romantic!. Our hotel was very near this viewpoint. It's lovely anytime of the day but especially in the evening as the city lights come on. Lots of locals come here to enjoy the incredible view. You should too!

Do this!. Part of Lisboa's charm is the presence of miradouros (lookouts) one may stumble upon while traveling around this magical city. These miradouros provide some of the most stunning views of the City of Lights. I highly recommend for you to visit Miradouro da Senhora do Monte at dusk. It's quite a hike all the way up top to this point of the city, but you will become enamored with Lisboa & all of its charm as you watch the lights come to life one by one after the sun rests for the day. I discovered this place during my third trip to Portugal. I fell in love with this city the first time I visited but seeing this breathtaking view made me gaze in awe at all of this city's splendor. No words can do this view any justice. Bring a sweater as it gets quite windy up there. Enjoy!

The best view in town (and it's free!). For me, it's the best sightseeing spot in Lisbon! It's mostly attended by tourists (a lot of portuguese/lisboners never heard of it).It doesn't have coffee places so you won't have noise around you. It's just you and an 180º view of Lisbon starting from Graça, São Jorge's castle, Baixa, Bairro Alto until the end of Avenidas Novas. Ps: Sunset in there is something you'll cherish for a long time :)
The Best View of Lisbon. Amazing spot with a huge view of Lisbon, my favourite. Located in Graça it worth a visit by taking the 28 tram
Lovely view of the city. In a city with lots of wonderful overlooks, this must be one off the best! We didn't take time to have a coffee, but others did and it looked like a very nice idea.
Run down and dirty . The panoramic views are nice but not as stunning as Alfama. The neighborhood around it is not very nice and the mirador itself is a bit dirty. There are no cafes or bars nearby

A must. Most beautiful view you could possible have of Lisbon! The entire city is visible from the Miradouro, is a great place if you would want to sit and read a book. It's also one the of the most (if not the most) romantic place in Lisbon, if you are travelling with a special someone, make sure you take the time to just take in the beautiful view of the Miradouro with each other.

AMAZING view. Sure, there were some stairs involved, but my goodness what a view. You get to see a huge chunk of the city from up high. The value is priced perfectly for me at 0 euro! Anyone who says the hike isn't worth it is crazy, definitely worth seeing if you have time.
Breathtaking view!. Well worth the walk to have the opportunity to see Lisbon from this point. The view is amazing. Great opportunity to take some nice photos. Would definitely

Good view of the city. It always amazes me how people live in such high points, having to climb up with their groceries on a daily basis. Luckily for us ( tourists) who comes to such places once or twice, this point is truly a reward for the effort.
Miradouro. great viewpoint with nice baroque church and a little cafe ....................................................
one of the most beautiful miradouro. Lisbon has a lot of miradouro i suggest to do all of them to be sure to see lisbon from every point of view

Not worth the long hike up. Miradouro da Senhora do Monte may be the highest viewpoint in Lisbon, but in my opinion it is too far from the river to get good pictures. The view from Castelo de Sao Jorge was much better, because from there you can see Praca do Commercio, Ponte de 25 Abril and Christo Rei all together. This place is free and Castelo costs 8,50 per person, so that's of course the positive thing about this place. If you have limited time in Lisbon, do not waste your day by hiking here as we did.
Scenic and beautiful. A great hike. 60 minutes from lisbon. Great scenic drive and hike . some of the best of what portugal country side can offer

The best view of Lisbon!. It's a really nice terrace above the city center from which you have a breathtaking view. Well worth the hill climbing to reach it. You can literally see everything. It's the best place for taking precious photos.

Great miradouro!!. best view we have had in lisbon! very high up, beautiful view! just very hard to find, there are no sign posts and the maps are basically useless! there is also no kiosk so don't expect a drink when you arrive! but it is a spectacular view, well worth the climb!

Worth the "climb". It's really high up and not very easy to reach. Also, there's not much to do in the surrounding areas. Probably the best views of the city though since you see the Castle, the river, downtown, etc.
Lovely city view. One of the most fantastic views of Lisbon. On the top of one of seven hills of Lisbon. Nearby you can visit the Castelo de São Jorge
Great view. Great view, but not very special. We spent to much time to get there but were completely disappointed! We enjoyed wandering at Alfama and Chiado more than here.

Best View of Lisbon. Absolutely fabulous view of Lisbon from this Mirador, I think it's the best in the city. Sunset looks lovely from here, and I think one of the main best things of this Mirador is the low amount of people that go there (I've heard this is were the locals go to have a stunning view of the city), expect the place to be really quiet and peaceful when compared to other spots in Lisbon. Although bring your own beverages and food as on top there is absolutely nothing apart from the stunning view.
Great view and excellent atmosphere. Every single Miradouro is special on its own right and you shouldn't miss the Senhora do Monte one, beautiful views and great atmosphere, full of locals!! Love it

Inspiring view. One of the most outstanding skyline views over Lisbon.Lisbon, the city of seven hills, offers you in Miradouro da Senhora do Monte, the possibility to overview lisbon and the outskirts with an astonishing sight.Take a bright sunny day to go there and you'll have a shinny picture!.Take na evening and you'll the charm of the night lights!But, please try to go there at sunset! Just unforgeatable!
Amazing view. One of Lisboa's top places to see the city and the castle!! Also great spots nearby to have a cheap lunch and enjoy neighborhood cosy scenarios.

Lisboa hill with a view. One of the best views over Lisboa old town. Go there by the sunset or after hours (by night time) and enjoy the view of the Castelo de São Jorge, Baixa, rio Tejo, ponte 25 de Abril, Chiado and more... Whatever your in, one hour of peace enjoying the view and thinking about the meaning of life or just passing by for 3 seconds is worthwhile the tour up there.

Lovely view. It does give a lovely view of the city and worth it for photos if you are round that way (short walk from the castle hill, for example), but it is a mirador with no major facilities other than a cafe bar.
Great view!. You've to go there! Great view. Go there by day and night both! See a huge part of the historic city centre!
Amazing view. One of the most amazing viewpoint's in the city, a combination of Lisbon slopes, Tejo river, Atlantic Ocean and the Castle of St.George.

One of the best views of Lisbon. While this small place isn't the most accessible one, it has one of the best views of Lisbon. From here you can in the horizon "Ponte 25 de Abril" and "Cristo Rei". On your left you'll be able to see the "Castelo of São Jorge" and in front of you downtown.
Fantastic look out point. One of the most breathtaking views to Lisbon...less tourists and excellent place to be to enjou a sunset.

Beautiful spot! Worth the hike!. This is a great spot! Relax and have a break. It is definitely worth making the trek by foot. Recommend getting lost on your way up through the town of alfama. Winding and and narrow passage ways.

Another overlook you must visit. The nice view (amazing during day or night) should be more than enough for you to visit. You don't need much time to see everything and might like to leave your "love locker" if you're visiting it with your pair. From here you can see a couple of other outlooks in the city, which deserve your visit. If you're just in business, you might want to stop by just for a quick look... It will worth your time!
really worth!. dont be scared of hike till here.is worth and not far from bus 28 stop!just a breathless view...nothing else:LISBOA IS HERE!
Miradouro da Senhora do Monte. Stunning views over the city. There are several 'Miradouro' sites to visit, each of the hills of the city of Lisbon.

Ok . . .. Bit boring. You can see all around but when you've been to Sintra or Funchal you will find this a little underwhelming. I think you get a better view from the castle too. May as well go there if you don't have much time.
Superb vantage point!. Amongst a few of viewpoints in Lisbon that I have been to (including Castelo de Sao Jorge), I can say this one offered the most incredible view. Just perfect for pictures!
Miradouro. Great place for 'legalized' travellers! The view is really amazing, but to get there is kinda trashy way

Nice view of St. George's Castle. Many people go to visit St. George's Castle to get the beautiful views of Portugal and the bridge, however, from this lookout (one of many in Lisbon), it's possible to get the bridge and the castle in the same view, so for people that would like to capture this in a photograph, this is a good outlook to go to. It's not hard to get to, a bit of uphill walking, but nothing terrible. There is a few benches around to sit, and a fence with a whole bunch of lovers locks left on it.It's peaceful and beautiful.

best views of the city. one of the highest points of Lisbon you can see almost all city. Situated in Bairro da Graça a picturesc neighbourhood, near other places like Mouraria, Alfama and the S. Jorge Castle you can try the famous 28 electric bus.

Nice view but nothing special. After reviewing all the recensions in Trip advisor (1st place of attractions in Lisbon)we have decided to visit this place to enjoy the view of the city.. We went there when it was already dark but honestly l expected more.. The view was nice but not breath-taking.. In my opinion much better view of different parts of the city you can have from the Castle.

A view to remember!. From Portugal Hotel towing a 4 year old daughter (she walked the first 10 mins) it took us 15 minutes -- hilly walk and narrow roads, steps, etc. but at the end it is all worth it! The view is spectacular! We walked about 2 mins to the main road then took a 3 min taxi which was about 3 euros! We would have walked but the daughter won't take another step, thus, the taxi. Very safe and highly recommended! Plus it's free!
Great place for a late night drink.. We went there for a late night drink, this place has a nice view, so pop up if you have time at thenight time or even durring the day.
One of many. There are many sightseeing places in the city and they are all amazing. It was great to spend the evening just enjoying the sunset even though it was a bit cold!

The most beautiful view!. This top notch thing to do when it's sunny and awesome when cloudy if you want to take timelapse of the sunset. Awesome vibe, people enjoing time, playing guitar, singing all together.

Highest lookout point in Lisbon. The best things in life are free like this beautiful view of the town especially at sunset. You look down upon the 7 hills, the castle, the river, the bridge of 25th of April, the Alfama, the churches and squares. Really international crowd up there, bring a bottle of wine and a tripod. When it is very busy, be aware of pickpockets.
Breathtaking view in the heart of Lisbon.. Do not miss this viewpoint if you like panoramic views of the city, bridge and bay. Turns into one of the most romantic places in Lisbon after the sunset.

Best (public) view over Lisbon. Been to Miradouro da Senhora do Monte many, many times in my life. It was one of my favourite spots to show the best of Lisbon, with no tourists around. Now went back and it is full of tourists. The now pervasive tuk-tuks stop there and have made it a major attraction. Regardless of this, it is still definitely worth a visit, as it has one of the best, if not the very best view from a public spot in and from Lisbon. Magic at sunrise or sunset in a warm day. No food or drinks there, go to the nearby Miradouro da Graça for that (a bit lesser view, yet still great).
Great Overlook. You can really see the city from here. We saw it New year's Day and there were a lot of empty champagne bottles around.
Spectacular View. Safe area!! Best time to visit is during sunset to enjoy the panoranmic view of Lisbon city overlooking the red-tled buildings of the city.
Poetic. this is the highest viewpoint in the center of the town, and the most lovely, with the little chapel of Sra de Monte
Got engaged here!. Definitely the best view of Lisbon. I recommend seeing it at night, when the city is lit up. My boyfriend proposed to me at this very special place. Don't miss it!
Great view in a great neighbourhood. Miradouro da Senhora do Monte is a great, calm watching spot, in a very traditional neighbourhood. Great place for the end of an afternoon.

Nice view over old lisbon. Miradouro is a fort that has quitte impressive views over old lisbon and the waterfronts. I liked it very much. However to get these amazing views you need to pay but I think it's definitely worth the money.

A view over the old town. Lisbon has many hills and on top of each you can appreciate the quietness and the beauty of a city that hasn't changed in years, thought is very cosmopolitan and modern on the inside.
The Best view from Lisbon!. I was here at nigth and the view from Lisbon, the Brigde, River is amazing! Is difficult to explain the beauty, you must go there!! :)
Romantic. Sunset was very romantic. We had croissants and coffee, perfect evening. I would suggest stopping by and bring lunch with you because it is one of the best views

The Best View of Lisboa. An amazing aerial view of the City, the castle on an adjoining hill, south to the river, the 25 April bridge, the monument of Cristo Rei (the latter two beautifully lit at night) and the hills of Arrabida; west across the city towards Estrela (the floodlit Basilica can be seen at night) and northwest towards the modern residencial and commercial tower blocks.The sounds of the city drifting up create a wonderful atmosphere.A wonderful place to sit and enjoy the most beautiful city in the world.

Best view in town!. By far the best view in town. On top of a hill, so you get to see most of the city, the castle and the bridge as well. Beautiful scenery. Bit difficult to find but worth the time. Not anything else to do there but you will enjoy the walk up there.
Great sunset view. Take the tram or walk up Alfama & enjoy the view. Great at anti me but better at sunset. A couple of small food stands sell drinks & snacks in the little plaza
Best city view. An excellent place, clean and typical with the best view of Lisbon!You can go by tuk-tuk to know this place.
nice view. you'll have a nice view over Lisbon, but that's it. My suggestion: Ideal for couples in love, take a bottle of champagne and two glasses and enjoy sunset

Best view. Little hard to find and away from the underground but has some buses around. Totally worth the effort but this is the favorite place in Lisbon . Incredible city view and it's quiet most of the day.recommended

Breath Taking. Beautiful spot to look out over the city. Great for a night out with friends, grab a bottle and sit to watch the view. Or a romantic stop for two love birds - bring a lock to seal your love with so many others on the fence. Definitely a must see spot!
Amazing view. After a few days of exploration in Lisbon visit this nice spot to see everything once. Recommended both for day and night visit.

Favorite place in Lisbon. A bit hard to find and away from the underground but has some buses around. Totally worth the effort, it's probably my favorite place in Lisbon speaking as a local. Incredible city view and it's quiet most of the day, nice to chillout. Only gets a bit windy sometimes. But it's a must do for any Lisbon visitor, then move to Graça, Panteão, Alfama or Castelo, all reachable by walking distance.

Gulbekian Foundation and Museums. Easily reached across Praca De Espagna the foundation has 3 main exhibits The permanent exhibit, a separate very good Spanish exhibition from the Spanish Royal palace In a separate building there is a modern gallery as well Don't expect a huge gallery but the quality is very good and it is well worth the visit Ask the reception they will be more than glad to give you the details After a peasant walk in the garden you can find the Modern part of the gallery which is very interesting as well Price is 5 euros each very reasonable I wrote this review because the foundation and Museum are listed as 2 separate entities in fact they are one located in different proximate buildings regards Bobby

Unparalleled Views of Lisbon. Lovely park over looking Lisbon. Views are truly spectacular. Fantastic photo opportunity. There is a tile map showing points of interest you are viewing. A similar map and view from the opposite side is available at the castle.

Lovely location and marvelous view. We enjoyed the time here with this fantastic view over the hills of Lisboa. You can sit down there at one of the benches, have a break and just enjoy. One of the things you have to do with good weather in Lisboa! A really nice and calm place beside the other visitors. Find it out!

Awesome view!. It is a bit of a walk up the hill to reach it, but when you reach it - wow! You will see whole Lisbon, terrain configuration and all the key points. It will be easier for you to explore the city later when you take a look from here.
Lovely view. It was a little cold and windy the night we went and the sunset was only average, but the location is excellent for a lovely view over Lisbon.
Great View. I really recommend Miradouo da Senhora do Monte. It is a must see in Lisbon.You can see this amazing city from the top.

Really far but nice. Indeed the highest point to view Lisbon, but it was not my favorite. I think that other Miradouros offer a closer and greater in my opinion view of the beautiful city of Lisbon. However, if you are a fan of the view from a great distance, I suppose this is the best option in the city.

Highest Viewpoint in Lisbon. This lovely spot was just up the hill from my hotel, but I did not go visit it until my friend who has lived in Lisbon for four year insisted on going up to see it (she had never been). The view of the city and out to the river were wonderful, even when it was overcast. The city of Lisbon is breathtaking in any weather.
tuk tuk!!. the view is fantastic, you have to take the Tuk Tuk, are incredible!! you can see everyting down in Lisbon!! the views are incredible!!

Great Views. The classic views of Lisbon. Definitely worth the effort of getting up there and make the most of it by walking up there if you can as some of the neighbour hoods are very quaint and picturesque.
great view of the city!. Takes a while go up here, but the view is breathtaking... great spot to see the sunset in the summer

Great view. Lovely spot to enjoy Lisbon with a great view.
Nothing around except you and the city! And some tourist :P

probably the best panoramic view over Lisbon. this miradouro / panoramic landmark gives the largest view over Lisbon. it is as well an opportunity to enjoy some quiet time watching the city as there not that many tourists.

View tower. We were in doubt if we should go up and see town from this tower.and I'm happy I convinced my travel partners to do so.everyone of us left tower happy for views we saw.well worth to spend yoyr money and see lisbon from above.

One of the top 3 mandatory Lisboa views. Point of Lisboa contemplation. One of the Lisbon "Miradouros" mpre appreciated by the locals.
Just contemplate.

fabulous . What else to add?
absolutely fabulous view over Lisbon.
I came back again at night and it was even better!

Best view in the city. This was a little difficult to find. I walked up through Baixa and Alfamo and walked past the street leading up twice before I actually found it, but it was worth it for the view

Breathtaking!. Breathtaking views!
Go there and get detached from 'life'!! witness the breathtaking sunset,,so majestic!
Beautiful view of Lisbon. And a great cafe to sit and enjoy the sites. Definitely worth the stop. Can see all of the old city and the Rio Tejo in the distance

Great city view. Easily accessible by foot from the city center. Great place for a picnic. Free! The small negative point about Lisbon in general is the lack of informative panels for the attractions. Easy to get lost in the small twisted roads.
Great place to take some photos and admire the view. Nothing much to say about this. A great place to view the city from, find your bearings, take some nice photos or just sit and enjoy the view.

One of the best spots to capture beautiful pictures of Lisbon. It seems that this miradouro is a bit out of the way, high up above Alfama, its quieter, and seems to have less tourists than other sites. The views are breathtaking! In the evening, you could pack a bit of a picnic with a bottle of wine and enjoy the sights and sounds of the town below while enjoying the evening. Once in a while, a tuktuk car will bring along a bunch of tourists, but they are there for about 20 mins before they move on to explore other parts of the beautiful Lisbon. Overall, this is a very nice spot for picture taking, both day and evening. We took pictures with our iPhones, but if you are fortunate enough to have one of those serious big cameras, they will find their calling here :) .

Good morning Lisbon. Sunrise and sunset are beautiful here. You have a wonderful view on the National Pantheon and the river.By 8 o´clock cruisers arrive nearly every day.San Antonio protects you (his statue).In the evenings it´s very lively with locals, tourists, musicians, dancers.
Nice overall view. Nice short walk up the hill from the trolley stop. Gives a nice view of a large amount of Lisbon, complete with boards which showed the skyline and labeled the buildings.

Fantastic view of a great city. Graca is the highest place in Lisbon. The viewpoint can be accessed by the 28 tram and getting off one stop after Largo Graca. Walk up the side street to the west and go around a gentle curve. Ahead will be Miradouro da Senhora do Monte with great views across Lisbon to St. Georges Castle, 25 de Abril Bridge, Cristo Rei monument, the twin towers and dome of Estrela Basilica and a constant parade of planes approaching Lisbon's international airport. No cafe or washrooms here. Best of all its free!
Great view.. Must see in Lisbon. You can see the river and Lisbon from upthere. Great scenario. Really close to Castelo São Jorge. I recommend it.

Beautiful View Point over Lisbon. There is a good dozen of miradouros overlooking the great city of Lisbon from different angles however the one at Nossa Senhora do Monte is very special. It is the highest one, rather small and far less crowded than the other ones because the access for large busses is not possible. It is close from the one at Nossa Senhora da Graça and much higher than the Castel Sao Jorge. Parking can be an issue however usually cars don't stay too long. You can find all the info about Miradouros at http://pt.lisboando.com/miradouros/
The best view. It doesn't have a bar/cafe, so it's not overcrowded like the one next to it in Graça.The view is incredible, the best of the city.Don't miss it!

beautiful free view of Lisbon. if you make it to the top of Lisbon's steep stairs and roads, you deserve the reward of the view.you see the center of Lisbon at 240° from an elevated place.it's nice in the morning, after lunch, at sunset... ok it's great all the time with my preference for sunset when you can play with your camera and make memorable panoramic pictures.compared to other places as the Castle or towers, this one is free ! and there is less people than at the Castle.think about getting a bottle of water for the climb as you walk through the residential part of Lisbon and will not see many bars/restaurants close to the top.sometimes there is a guy with a mobile ice/drinks selling machine but not every day.

wondefull views. It's a nice place to take a break and take a look at the landscape.
For sure a place to visit in lisbon.
Best view in Lisbon. It was amazing to be there and look at the view... It's hard to explain just how gorgeous it was. Must see!
very beautiful place to visit. when i was at lisbon , we visit this Miradouro , by the originals TUK TUK , it´s an amazing place , with a small chapel .,Awesome place to go
Melhor vista de Lisboa. The best views in Lisbon. The nearby streets need to be requalified. Lots fo abandoned buildings when you walkj down to thge city center in Arroios.
great views if not the best of the city. Bring some snacks and drinks with you along around sunset and see what happens when the sun goes down......

Great view. on the hilltop. Easy toreach, though, with TRAM 28 (Graca). Then a short street climb and you are there. It's a windy place and has trees, so it's quite nice to just stay there on a hot day, admiring the city.
(and has a very clean bathroom, although dated)

The best view I have found so far. A moderately quiet place with a beautiful view over Lisbon centre (at least you'll find there less people than at "wild beaches" around Lisbon). It's not that busy as the ones in other, more touristic areas. Sometimes wind gets really strong out there, so be prepared for that. Perfect spot for late night chat supported by a bottle of wine.

Nice!. I got this compulsive need to see a citys view first time visiting. It took me 20 minutes to walk from my hotel, and I got to see the entire city of Lisbon. Probably pretty sweet to watch the sunset - as I was there at daytime. It´s worth the trip, and it´s free of charge.

Great for watching the sunset over the city. We were recommended to go here by a friend from Lisbon. It's a less touristy viewing point... a little harder to find but near to the 28E tram line. Beautiful view!

Incredible View of the City. If you want to see the entire city, then I HIGHLY recommend you come here. The view is simply amazing! Just take tram 28 to Rua Graca, then heading in the same direction as the tram, turn left up 'Rua da Senhora do Monte' and follow the road straight up. It's just breathtaking!
Incredible view. It is worth the walk. Just bring some water and be ready to find the most incredible view of that beautiful city.

beautiful view. It was not all that easy to get to this viewpoint, but it was definitely worth the effort. As it is more off the standard tourist track, there are not so many people as in different places and you can enjoy the view. Take the tram 28 to Largo da Graca, then it is about 5-10 minutes walk up the street.

BREATHTAKING VIEWS!. This place was super hard to find as all we had was a map and there are NO signs for this very hidden gem. We asked for directions along the way & finally found our way up the dreaded steps .. quite a workout indeed! When we got to the top the view was amazing! We made it just before sunset and watched the sun go down and the city light up ; quite the transformation! This is truly a must-do in Lisbon ... although hard to find it is very well worth the chase ;)

steps steps and more steps. Get your walking shoes on as its a fair old climb to the viewing point. It is worth it as reviews are breathtakingky beautiful, I was stunned at the gorgeousness of it. Bag yourself a bench under the shade of a tree and drink in the view. There's a cafe there for a beer and a snack.
Wauv!. It takes a bit of walking to get there but it worth it! The view is unbelievably beautiful. The city, the river, a splendid view. It's a 'must do' in Lisbon.

5 star view. you will be left speechless after seeing this 180 degree view of all of Lisbon. recommend going right before sunset, and watching the lights come on all over the city. bring your camera!!

One of my favorite sightseeing in Lisbon. From here, one can see the beauty of Lisbon. At Sunset there´s a kind of magi happening. It´s a really cool place to go with someone or alone, with a book and a camera.
Beautiful and non comercial scenic spot. So picturesque, and such a beautiful chapel.Not 100's of people mulling around ~ just peaceful and lovely

Lisbon at your feet. This is one of the highest viewpoints in Lisbon, and one who is mostly ignored. You will feast your eyes on a gorgeous landscape, while sitting down and enjoying a drink or something to eat. It is easy to get there on foot, and absolutely worth it.
The view. Going there by foot, totally worth it, I've seen all the narrow streets. Very nice view of the city.

Gorgeous Panoramic. There are plenty of belvideres located throughout the city, but this is my second favorite after Miradouro das Portas dol Sol. Situated high above the city, it affords you a great view of the charming, red-roofed neighborhood of Alfama below. You can take the Tram or walk by foot (which I prefer because it allows you to wander aimlessly and explore the town leisurely) to arrive here where blue azules tiles adorn the balcony. You'll also find local artists showcasing their work for sale and a cute garden alongside this overlook. Take a moment to soak in the view and enjoy the city from above!

By tram no 12. If you want to try Lisbon old tram and don't want to be like a sardine in a tram no 28. Buy ticket in Casa da Sorte at Praca Figueira and take tram no 12, get off at this Miradour, which is also a great point to explore Alfama.

Best view of the city. As well as this spot we visited the castle and a couple of other viewpoints and this is definitely the best. You'll get a view across the whole city looking out to the ocean behind the castle. It's a little difficult to get to but we followed the map and found it fine.

The most beautiful view over Lisbon!. This is my personal favorite view over Lisbon. It has easy access and on top you can have sights over Ponte 25 de Abril, Martim Moniz, Castelo de São Jorge, Rio Tejo and southern coast of Tejo with Cristo Rei looking at you. My advice: go there close to sunset and stay till night comes, the change in the city colors is just amazing!

Any time of day or night. There are a number of places in Lisbon where you can have a beautiful view over the city. This one is certainly one of the best and the most easily accessible. Day or night, the view is lovely.
Beautiful City Views. There are a few miraduoros in Lisbon, but this one is the most beautiful at sunset and has one of the best unobstructed city views in all of Lisbon.

Best view of Lisbon full stop. If your thinking of visiting the miradouro Graça for its view of Lisbon's Baixa keep heading upwards to this view point, Senhora do Monte by far the best view point for Lisbon i have ever seen. If you're having trouble finding it just ask the locals they are more then happy to give directions. It is a must for anybody visiting Lisbon.
What a view. This hidden place near Graça is a must see place!It have a very little chapel, but the view... WHAT A VIEW!

Just a view of the 25th April bridge. Nothing special.. Just a small area where you can see the view of the 25 April bridge. You can view the bridge from other areas.If you are already in the area, then take a look. But I would not recommend making a trip just to come here for the views. Nothing special about the area.

NICE VIEW OVER LISBON. Nice View ! maybe better than Graça !...it´s next to Graça view ! there is a Church and a Santa (Montain Saint).No Bar, no restaurant ! Only the View point ! I recomend you to go !
The views are Amazing. I had beautiful blue clear skies on Monday, May 12. Was bought here by our bike sidecar tour guide an excellent stop for anyone.

Great view. This is relatively easy to find (just up Rua de Misericordia off Largo do Chiado) and has great views of the key areas of the city. There are also street performers up there. Great if you like landscape photography as a hobby. A peaceful place.
Great view!. Really worth the climb. Great view of lisbon centre, especially when the sky is clearblue. Chilled there for about 20minutes.
Beautiful Landscape. It requires a big walk specially because you have to climb, but the view that you have there is amazing!
Splendid views. The Miradours of Lisbon are great places for keen photographers. The view of the hilltops and the casle are magnificent.
Great view of the city. Been there first time every one month ago and feel like I have never seen the city from that point. Little cafe with food and beverages available.

Also another amazing view. If you go to Miradouro da Graça, please take your time to view this MIradouro as well. Is also situated in Graça,but higher, so better view. It has a small romantic chappel there and also a romantic hostel with an amazing view in that Miradouro. You can go there with friends or family, but my suggestion would be for you to go there with the Love of your life.

lovely viewpoint in Lisboa. this is one of my favourite viewpoints in my home town.it is "just" a viewpoint, with a little church, and with an image of one of our saints (nossa senhora do monte).you won't find any coffeeshops or restaurants there, just some wooden benches, and maybe some eldearly or couples or (if you go around dinner time or later) some groups of friends having their beers there (specially on weekends).maybe you can find the church opened and you can take a look inside!but if you love to walk and don't care about the cold wind, you will find it pretty cool! i reccommend going there early morning till sunset. and don´t forget to bring a jacket! :)
Great view. Quite a trek up the hill, but a fantastic view from the top of here over the whole of Lisbon and all around the coast.

Must see for the view of Lisbon - beware of pickpockets!. This is a must see when visiting Lisbon. We went at sunset and had a gorgeous view of all of Lisbon. Only downside is that a pickpocket stole my iPad from my handbag outside of the entrance of the monument when I wasn't holding onto it for all of 45 seconds! These guys are criminal masterminds. Turn your head for thirty seconds and they'll reach into your bag without you feeling anything. I went to the tourist police (who were really nice and helpful actually) but I'll never get my iPad back! Beware!

Great view, with a drink by your side. Get there late in the evening, for a great view of Lisbon by night, and a drink away from the crowds of the town center - as a group of friend (2 couples) we had a flat rented nearby, and we walked there late in the evening just after arriving - the place was busy but quiet, perfect to relax and get in the right mood.
Amazing view. Amazing view of Lisbon where you can see the entire city with the Castle, you can spend a few hours there just to enjoy the city and the view
Go go go. Amazing view of many in Lisbon. When you think you are loat, just keep goimg. Bring a book or some wine and enjoy the people and view.

Best view ever!. Without a doubt, this is the best view in Lisbon. The panoramic view encompasses the castle and the bridge in Lisbon. It's pretty steep and I was fortunate I had a car up this attraction.

Outstanding view. Ok so to be clear there is a lot of walking needed mostly uphill to get here, but when you reach it the view is certainly worth it. You can look out across all of Lisbon's major areas and really spend some time up there and enjoy the view. Highly recommended, there are also a few cannons to be found overlooking the city, great photo opportunities.
Excellent view. I love the view.Been there a few times, and from time to time I feel the need to repeat and walk all the way up.
Stunning view. Great view of lisbon, there are 2 lookout points. Best to go when the sky is dark and the sky is clear.

the best view of lisbon. the best view of lisbon during day and night time ... But specialy during night time ... We went there in a tour with a guy called Alexander from Discover With Us tour ... Great time!! Thanks Alexander ... Hope to return soon!

Stunning. On our walk around on our first evening in the city we ventured up the hill towards the Miradouro da Senhora do Monte. It is a beautiful place with an amazing view of the city. Sunsets from there can be spectacular.

Fabulous view of the city and sunset. Our Tuc Tuc driver drove us up here after our tour of the Se Cathedral. It is a beautiful place with an amazing view of the city. We were also lucky enough to experience a beautiful sunset which was spectacular.
Beutiful views. Beautiful views from this viewpoint, you can have a nice sight of Lisbon, ranging from the Castle, the Tejo River, Baixa and Chiado.
Lovely view of the city. one of the best views over Lisbon. Amazing view on the city centre and the river. Worse visiting and relaxing there for a little while
best vew with castle included. I love how the vew is so perfect and so amazing i belive that it was the best Lisbon experience. I want to come back really fast.

The most beatiful viewpoint of Lisbon. This Miradouro has one of the best views over Lisbon. A place to visit and sit for a few hours. Saddly doesn't have a coffee shop, would be perfect to have an cup of tea with that view.
The Most Beautiful and Romantic. One of the most romantic and enchanted places of Lisbon. Amazing view on the city centre and the river.

Difficult to discuss which is the best.... ....due to the hilly position of Lisbon, it has a lot of wonderful "Miradouros". This one is at the top of the oldest city part named Alfama, close but higher than the Sao Jorge castle. From here you can have great views over the castle, the downtown city center, the 25th April bridge (remember, this is NOT the Vasco de Gama bridge, like some other travelers said) and the opposite hill of Bairro Alto and Chiaddo.A little church at this view point makes this place special and romantic, with a small square, an open air cafe and some benches.Have in mind, the access to this Miradouro is difficult, it is on a steep hill, and you have to walk uphill a lot, but it is rewarding when you reach it.

Best view in Lisbon. One of the best views in Lisbon, this gem is well worth a walk up the hill from Graça for. There's no café there - so grab a bottle of vinho verde and make a little picnic and watch the sunset
Amazing view over Lisbon. The place is quite big and has many nice spots where you can see the nice city of Lisbon. There is an entry fee, but it's worth every cent!

The best Miradouro in Lisbon. This as to be my favorite Miradouro in Lisbon! It is usually not very crowded and the view is just something else. The chapel adds a bit of charm to the place. It really feel like those hidden gems!
unique. amazing view for the city, the river, the bridgewonderful atmosphere of travellersromantic and magical placevery special
Best view of Lisbon. This is the best view of Lisbon for sure - you can see a castle, miradouro da graça, the Vasco da Gama bridge and the statue of Jesus, many squares and Santa Justa lift.
Lovely. Beautiful view. I just returned from a 2 month trip to Lisbon and this was one of the better miradouros there. Lisbon is beautiful from every angle!

DO NOT MISS. Seriously. I've been traveling all over Europe, and through Lisbon, and I haven't found a more impressive view of the city. You're up high enough to capture everything, but close enough to see the intimate details of the streets and buildings. To top it off, your view of Lisbon has this stunning river and a Golden Gate style bridge as a backdrop. Take Tram 28 up there, or walk, but make sure you check it out.
280º View. Is the best place to see Lisbon. From there you can see the river, the castle, many, many churches, dowtown, "bairro alto" Maques de Pombal.

Best view in town!. Very nice view over Lisbon. You can reach is with the vintage tram line 28. Get out at Largo da Graca.I like walking, so I walked up there, which is a beautiful scenery walk and lots of nice cafes along the road to get refreshments.
Amazing sight!!!!. Just stopped at the Miradouro this past weekend while visiting Lisbon....The views are fantastic and a perfect place to sit and realx while the sun sets.....

Best viewpoint in Lisbon. I've lived in Lisbon for 8 years and this is my favourite place in the hole city! It's usually not so crowded as other viewpoints and has breathtaking views! Every traveller should take the time to come here, prederably at sunset.
Breathless. The best view over Lisbon, period. Do not visit the city without going there, astonishing view, so beautiful. Love it!

Nice to see, if more than one day in lisbon. Yes, as others told, when you get there by tram 28E, you have a magnificent view of the small gulf and old town of Lisbon. You need to put 2-3 hours for this activity (specially in hot seasons), because the trams are very crowded and with irregular schedule. We could take few great panoramic photos around sunset.

A Great View as the Sun is Setting!. We went here as the sun was setting and the view was amazing! This was part of a walking tour. The view is a must on the 'to do' list!Tip: On the way down from the lookout there are several little restaurants where locals eat, where you can have a yummy dinner at a great price. When you sit down they serve bread, cheese, sometimes olives etc. These are not free & if you eat them you will have to pay for them. Sometimes when added together these items cost more than the meal. You can say you don't want them & the items will be happily taken away or you can choose what you do & don't want from what they have brought. This is acceptable practice.
A must whilst in Lisbon. Magnificent views of the city and the Tejo River. Great little side walk cafes to just sit and enjoy the atmosphere of the medieval Alfama.

My favourite viewpoint in Lisbon !. If you go to Largo Graça this "Miradouro" is just a little bit up the hill. It is a small and quiet place , with a small chapel and Holly Mary image is there to accompany you. I think is a very peaceful place , the view is just stunning and you can stay there and relax for a while just absorbing the great energy flow. Its funny because not many people living in Lisbon knows it, its a well kept secret and I advice everyone to visit it if you can!

The place!. The better sightseeing place in Lisbon is in the other side of Bairro Alto. As a great view of all Lisbon, the bridge and the monuments. Could be better clean... but the view is marvelous!
Lisbon at it's splendour. BEAUTIFUL! Marvelous views of Lisbon, Castle, river. This is an outstanding way to discover the town and see Lisbon magnificent and traditional red roofs.

Gorgeous views. BEAUTIFUL! Gorgeous views of Lisbon, The S. Jorge Castle, the Tagus river. Make sure you take a camera with you. Been there during the day and at night. Night views are way more stunning

Excellent view and a place to take a drink. Amazing view and there's also two places where you can take something to eat and drink and still see the water. We took the tram one time only to take something to drink and look at the view. It's a bit more peaceful than down in the city centre.

Nice view of the Western city. From this elevated view point you get a good view of western lisbon.Quite a steep climb up but worth the view.There is some shade we made it late afternoon so was still hot.The walk back can take down some steep steps and in to the more rundown area of lisbon and off the beaten track.

Must see any time of the day!. My friend and I took the 28 Tram and got off at R. Graça then walked up Rua de Senhora de Monte. We actually more or less happened upon this great spot though we had heard about it previously. Does not take much time but absolutely worth the trip up there because the view is breathtaking and unbeatable. No bathrooms around that we could find and not a whole lot of food. We were there during the day but another friend went at night and said it was unbelievable then too - so go at any time!

Where narrow streets become huge vistas!. Not to be missed - it's free apart from the effort of getting there, which is well worth it.We'd seen this vantage point marked in a guide book, but it's not on every map so this could be easily missed.We found using more than one map really handy. As well as showing different features, they name different streets, so having more than one map is a great help to find your way around.

Where you take in the beauty of Lisbon. Our tour guide drove us here at the end of our day trip around Lisbon. We had been around the city for the whole day and it was breathtaking to see it all from above, framed with olive trees (growing around the benches, bearing fruit) ; The castle, the city, the ocean. No wonder we saw many locals enjoying a sunny afternoon on the benches!

beautiful view. You must see the city from here, its simply the best. Its also next to the cathedral and castle. It is a bit of a hike up to the point and we visits via Segway. Keep them s in mind when making the trek up to the vista.

Superb view of Lisbon. Took a taxi up from the square, €4 app and walked back down via narrow streets. Most beautiful church at the top, with the most exquisite crib I have ever seen. Views are superb all over Lisbon from viewing area.

the view. Fantastic view over the hills of Lisbon. It is worth walking in the lovely streets of the city to explore the sights and than go up here and connect all of them while sitting in one of the pubs and relax after a long day of walking.
Fantastic view over Lisbon. It is worth the walk up the steep hill to get to this place. My suggestion is to get on the tram although you will still have to walk the last km.

Where to look from freedom. Lisbon has a lot of "miradouros" and places from which you can have a look of the city from above. It is a really nice view and you can take some time to unwind and admire it.

breathtaking spot. Here you can enjoy the best views of Lisbon, Tago and Castle. All the city at your feet! Please take a couple of minutes to admire and appreciate wonderful colors of this stunning city, and your soul will thank you!

Stunning view of the city, sunset and the castle. This is undoubtedly the best miradouro in whole Lisbon, and believe me I went to all of them. It gets a little windy here so take a light jacket or something to keep you warm. The view of the city you get from here will just blow your mind away. You see the bridge, Cristo Rei statue and the castle. And the best part is, it is not so crowded! DON'T MISS THIS!

Excellent Vistas, cafe's at overlook, take the bus or trolley. The view was spectacular, but the drive up (in VW Polo stick, diesel) is not for the faint of heart. narrow streets, deceptive GPS, one ways sending you back over your tracks, I would take the 29 trolley, I think, ask first, which takes you on a trip through the whole area (very crowded though).
Beautiful spot. One of the best views in Lisbon, which says a lot in such a beautiful city! The hike up is worth it.

Stunning rest spot. What a great place to visit if you have limited time for taking in an experience of Lisbon! The views are spectacular, and it is a perfect place to take in a casual lunch at the concession there which serves delicious grilled cheese sandwiches and ice-cold beer. The approach to this attraction, following the tram tracks a short distance into the colorful Alfama District from Lisbon's commercial center below is easier than you might suppose, and well worth the small effort.
Sunset place. Really worth climbing! Take some snack with you and picknick, there is no cafe or shop around! BUT do not expect to be alone:-)

Can't miss it. Enjoy the view. Lisbon is a beautiful city!
Also, if you can, try to visit the church near by,it's also amazing.

Find yourself there!. A perfect getaway in the city!Just you and the view... and it doesn't make a difference if it is summer or winter!It's quiet, local, almost hidden - not completely because it's seen from several points, and one always wonders "there must be an amazing view from up there!" - and it is!And also one of the best points in Lisbon for photoshooting!
One of the best Lisbon views. This place has one of the best views over the city, being a "must see" for anyone.It is not a touristic place, but is turning more and more popular.
One of the best views of Lisbon. A definite must stop after a long day of walking up and down the hills of Lisbon. Great views to take in the city and relax. Bring your camera!
A view a beer and a "bica" (Portugese espresso). Well worth the trip to the top, either walking the narrow, windy old cobblestoned streets or riding the colorful tram wending its way up.
Amazing. Best place to relax and enjoy the beautiful city of Lisbon. The view is amazing, and the cafe on top helps you relax from a long day walking in Lisbon.

Nice view if not raining. Love view of the city but I would not necessarily go out of my way to visit. The location is however a great place to start a tour of old Lisbon, with great cares, old churches and monasteries, and a taste of non touristy Lisbon life.

Lovely panoramic view with cafe. There was a decently priced cafe (4.5 euros - 7.9 for lunch), the views were lovely, you could see the castle amd most of Lisbon but it can be a bit windy and cold. It's a place to visit if you have some time.
One of the best viewpoints in Lisbon. Although much less explored, this is probably one of the best viewpoints in Lisbon.Enjoy the sunset if you are nearby, you will love it ;)
One of the best city Views I have ever seen.. As people have said, do it before sunset to get the most out of it, awesome. Easy to get to too, so everyone is a winner.
Best panoramic view. This sightseeing spot offers the widest view over Lisbon. It is quiet and pleasant... The effort of getting there is worth it!
stunning. Absolutely stunning view... We stayed there for three hours, and watched beautiful sunset… We were lucky to meet there one old fado singer who contributed to have morw than amazing time…
nice view. Nice view over the city, and you'll see a nice cathedral too. Can be reached by tram or taxi (which are cheap).

The highest viewpoint!. Of all the major Miradouro tourist viewpoints in Lisboa, this one is the highest and provides the most sweeping, panoramic views of Lisboa and the river beyond. But if you have the time, all the viewpoints are worth visiting because they each provide a different scope and perspective of Lisboa.

Good for the sunset. Very windy, being so high, but worth the effort to get here. No cafe just a small chapel. We visited on a morning, but was well worth returning for the sunset as well as the fabulous views.
The highest belvedere in town. The highest belvedere in town, so get ready for a fantastic view, went there with a friend to see the sunset, great moment!

Best View of Lisbon. I must say, after seeing almost all the miradouros in Lisbon, this is the one that has the best view. It is located at the highest point of the city. You practically look over the whole of downtown Lisbon, the Tagus and the iconic Ponte 25 de Abril from here. It also has the most relaxing ambiance as it is less crowded compared to Miradouro da Santa Luzia and Portas do Sol that you will pass along the way. You can reach the miradouro by taking the famous Tram 28, it's worth the long and uncomfortable tram ride!

Breathtaking view of Lisbon. Astonishing view of Lisbon and the river Tagus! It's a small miradouro making it really sweet and "human-sized". It has a little church/chapel and a saint outside with the rosary around it. It has some trees creating shade for the benches so you can enjoy the view. This is where the famous tiles saying "Boa Viagem. Lisboa Espera Por Ti" which means "Have a good trip. Lisbon waits for you".

Fantastic Views. This is off the beaten track a bit but is well worth looking for. You can get a number 28 tram to a stop about 400m away and then navigate some side roads to find it.The views are stunning. You can see right across Lisbon, over the river to Christo Re and the Pont 25 Abril as well as lots of other places in the city. The small shrine is also very pretty.If you want to walk back down to central Lisbon, there are some steps to the side, but beware they are very steep at the top and very narrow so not good to go down if you have a pushchair or similar.

Incredible View. Breath taking view... I went on New Years Day, so there was a lot of trash on the ground from what was apparently a raucous party the night before... but I still found the spot peaceful and enjoyed the view for several minutes.

A great panorama of the city. If you wanna have a charming impression of the city, this is the place. You see S. George's Castle, the Sé (Cathedral), the elevator, the Comercio square and the Tejo river. Let yourself get lost on the streets and get to the castle right away.

One good sightseeing point. This is one of several sightseeing points in Lisbon where you can observe all of the downtown area and some of the rest of the town.The area itself is very small with some chairs and trees. There is a very small church too.There is no space for a coffee shop or any other kind of shop, which makes this spot cosy. It's an important spot to me since it was here that me and my wife started to date.It's a very nice place at night with all the city lights but it gets windy so take a coat.There is no parking lot, it's very difficult to park since it's a residential area.

Extraordinary view of Lisbon. Probably one of the best views of Lisbon. Nearby we see the battlements of Castelo de São Jorge. Down we can see the roofs of the houses that extend down to the Praça do Martin Moniz. On the other side of the hill we could see the Miradouro de São Pedro de Alcantara and the Convento do Carmo. We may also sit on the small terrace and drink a coffee or a beer in the evening enjoying the sunset. We also visit the beautiful church which is located on site. Not to be missed.
Best view of Lisbon. Probably the best view of Lisbon. Nice to hang out for a while or to go for a coffee. Its one of those places that you cant stop staring at the view. packed on weekends..
Oh wow!. What a view, what a mood! I simply love it. You seat under a tree, you enjoy your beer and watch Lisboa...priceless.
Check out the miradors, view points, whenever you can. The city and surrounds are more easily appreciated from the miradouro so do go to them and view the extraordinary views that they provide.
A very very good viewpoint!. If you've been wondering around Alfama all day, this is a good place to finish and watch the sun go down! Very refreshing, not too big. The highest point of Lisbon.

The highest point in Lisbon. And definately one of the best! From here you get a unique perspective of the city, and there is also a small chapel on the hill, said to be blessing to pregnant women. Enjoy the view!
Simply the best view in Lisbon. No one goes there cos there is no bus stop (less than 5 mins walk from 28e tho) and no kiosk. However, this is by far the best view of Lisbon.
Great view!. There's a nice little, well-stocked bar and a little park to spend an hour +, calmly enjoying Lisbon.
Awesome. One of the best places of Lisbon to see the whole town, great sunsets, rest after a walk.

beautiful - especially for sunset. Very nice lookout, over viewing the whole city. Especially nice for sunsets as the small bar serves wine for only 1.8 -2.3 euros per glass (the latter being worth the extra 50 cent). It might be quite windy up there, so bring a light jacket. We always 'hiked' up from metro station Martim Moniz (small streets and at last a steep stairway) adding to the experience and justifying the extra glass of wine.
Wow!. As a Lisbon native, for me it's the best view from the city! You feel you've reached the top, you're above all the roofs.
Breathtaking. Maybe the most spectacular and wide view of the city of Lisbon and beyond.
The best view in Lisbon. The best miradouro in Lisbon.. qlmost 180 gegree view and pretty church behind

Nice view, good point of departure. Apart from the fortress/castle, this is a splendid place to get an overview over Lisboa. It´s also a perfect place to start exploring Bairro Alto, the most charming part of the city, as far as I´m concerned. Take the Elevador da Glória if you´re coming from downtown.

enjoy the view. From the Miradouro you can see the tagus river, the St. George's castle as well as Baixa and Chiado. It's nice to sit there, watch and say nothing. You can reach the Miradouro from the Graca square (tram 28 stops there) in 5 minutes. On our way up we met a cute puppy...
British Engineering on display. Brilliant Babcock and wonderful walk round and grate location
high on the hill. absolutely the best views of Lisbon but it is a bit of a climb from the tram stop

Either the best or the second best miradouro in Lisbon. If you want to watch the sun set over Lisbon, this is the place to be. If you want to see an overall view of the city, then the Miradouro de São Pedro de Alcântara is the one you want. It would be hard to choose between the two, and I'm very glad I visited both during my stay in Lisbon.
Oustanding View. Surely, one of the most beautiful places in Lisboa.
Great balcony for Lisbon!. Beautiful view to Lisbon downtown plus there's an esplanade.

One of the best views of Lisboa. Lisbon has a lot of viewpoints, from which you can see many wonderful views of the city. And the Miradouro da Senhora do Monte provides one of the best views of Lisboa.

Nice city view, but not the safest one. This is a place where you have a beatiful view of the entire city, but you should go there during the day, because during the night this area is dark and poorly illuminated.
Let me tell you.... This is one of the best places in Lisbon to enjoy the beautiful colours after sunset. On the top of one (out of seven) hills, it gives you an amazing sensation of peace
panorama. That really is one of the best panoramic experiences to have a view of this wonderful city!

Best Miradouro in Lisbon. This is my absolute favorite 'miradouro' (viewpoint) in a city full of them. It's located in the neighbourhood of Graça, a bit further than the Miradouro de Graça, and a bit higher, so the views are even better. I think this is the perfect spot to admire the city: the castle, the Baixa, Bairro Alto, the 25 de Abril bridge... Unlike other 'miradouros', you won't find a small bar here, but it is really worth the effort to get away from the typical touristic routs. Really, you will thank me later...
amazing view. this is one of the most beautiful points to get a glimpse of the whole city
